title: UC Berkeley
description: I completed my Masters of Information and Data Science having taken 9 courses totaling 27 units. The classes focused on data science, machine learning, and statistics. My capstone project was a research paper on the use of Multi Agent Reinforcement Learning to automate windfall apple harvesting.

title: University of Bern
description: I attended a six month graduate program in Artificial Intelligence having taken 3 courses. The classes where on Natural Language Processing with transformers, Optimization Algorithms other than Gradient Descent, and Human-Computer Interaction.

title: Stevens Institute of Technology
description: I completed my Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Minor in Pure and Applied Mathematics having taken 27 courses totaling 76 units. I transferred into Stevens in my Junior year after spending 2 years at Santa Rosa Junior College. I was the vice president of the Stevens Computer Science Club and a teaching assistant for Introduction to Quantum Computing and Data Structures.

title: CIEE
description: I enrolled in a study abroad program studying Japanese Art History. They were taught in English, but I became fascinated with the Japanese language and culture. I spent my free time learning Japanese and exploring the city, and have continued studying Japanese for the last several years.
